title: Ukraine's President Offers a Deal for Peace
summary: Ukraine's president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, has suggested a new idea to help end the war with Russia. He wants to make a part of eastern Ukraine, called Donetsk, a special area where there are no soldiers and businesses can trade freely. This is a compromise because Russia wants Ukraine to give up this land. The war has been going on for four years, and this proposal might help in peace talks led by the United States. However, Russia has not said if it will agree to this plan. Zelenskyy shared this idea with journalists in Kyiv, and it is part of a bigger peace plan with 20 points. The goal is to stop the fighting and find a way for Ukraine to keep its independence while making peace.

background_read: Ukraine is a country in Europe that has been at war with Russia since 2022. Russia invaded Ukraine and took over some areas, including parts of Donetsk. Peace talks are meetings where leaders try to find ways to stop the fighting. A compromise is when both sides in a disagreement give up something to reach an agreement. This article talks about a new idea from Ukraine's president to help make peace.
Article_Structure: WHO: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, the president of Ukraine
WHAT: He proposed making Donetsk a demilitarized free economic zone as a compromise in peace talks
WHERE: In Kyiv, Ukraine, and it involves the Donetsk region in eastern Ukraine
WHY: To address Russian demands and potentially end the war, though Russia has not agreed yet

perspectives.description: Zelenskyy is trying to find a peaceful solution to keep Ukraine independent while ending the war.
